Reviews.Title: “If you don't need to sleep”
Reviews.Author: taylancs
Reviews.Content: Hotel in need of renovation. It stands on a six lane road and doesn't have double glazing. It is also near fire, police and ambulance so it was constant traffic and sirens going all night! The room we had was large with a balcony overlooking the road. It also caters for parties of students who run riot even when told to behave. Breakfast was good and the reception staff brilliant - nothing was too much trouble. The area around the hotel and on the route to Ramblas is a bit rough with lots of winos sleeping rough. Would definitely not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Student Study Trip”
Reviews.Author: Durbin46
Reviews.Content: The Hotel for starters is 2 star... does exactly what it says on the tin. its basic. But it has what you need from a cheap hotel. We had 41 people in our group, spread across a number of rooms. Mine was a 4 bed on the top (8th) floor, which was very spacious, had a balcony, en-suite with a bidet. The shower was very good however if you like to have a bath then look elsewhere, as the bath was cut in half to save space in some rooms I saw. Location is brilliant, restaurant on the doorstep was very good and friendly. Tube stations nearby. View from the rear of the hotel sees the sagrada familia. Some of the group complained about noise at night, myself personally slept peacefully every night, (few beers and a night cap in the restaurant on the doorstep before bed) plus the top floor only has 3 rooms on it so the noise there is minimal.

Reviews.Title: “update”
Reviews.Author: 80sunshine
Reviews.Content: We have just spent a week here. Prepaid for double rooms and was given twins which would have been cheaper. We were offered a double but the room was so tiny with an awful outlook so we accepted the twins. the hotel wasn't in a very nice part of the city but was convenient for getting around. We got to see five rooms and all were very scruffy, bathrooms especially. We didn't have a plug in ours and when I requested one the receptionist said she didn't have one, neither did she have a key for the safe in our room.The TV didn't work and the hair-dryer fell to bits when taken off the hook but it did work. A tap in one of the bathrooms wouldn't turn off so the sound of constant trickling water had to be put up with. The curtains are ripped but are taped up with gaffer tape. the towels were threadbare but clean and changed daily. The matresses are past there best. A maggot was on my bed when I first arrived and where it came from is still a mystery. Although the stay wasn't the best and we would never return or recommend it to anyone we got through and enjoyed the city.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid”
Reviews.Author: NickRimmer
Reviews.Content: Many corners cut to "upgrade" this hotel. Decoration in bathroom not finished and to poor quality. Room was dusty from decoration - I had to clean-up before putting clothes in wardrobe. Staff had a "don't care" attitude. No WiFi except in reception. Poor value for money.

Reviews.Title: “AVOID! AVOID! Worst hotel of my adult life”
Reviews.Author: Sicnarfer
Reviews.Content: Hot rooms, no A/C, could not turn off heat. Very dirty. Rude staff who did not care or even acknowledge complaints. Tiny rooms directly over a very busy avenue (traffic noise all night). Hard bed. No WIFI. My colleagues had an even worse experience with no water, no cold water, and broken pipes. Saw cockroach in breakfast room. I travel constantly and have stayed in thousands of hotels all over the world including Barcelona, but this is the single WORST of all! I would rather sleep in my rental car next time! AVOID! AVOID!

Reviews.Title: “GBB Hotel Auto Hogar is 'The Hotel from Hell'”
Reviews.Author: EZMR
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel from Feb 26 - March 1st 2012 in tower 2. Upon arrival there was dirt and mud in my room and bathroom. Tried to call reception via a dusty phone but it was not connected. Window in bedroom opened into a closed courtyard so no fresh air. The aircon only blew out hot and smelly/dusty air, so that had to stay off as well. Impossible to open bathroom window as it fell out of its frame when you tried to. The fittings in the shower were loose and had been fitted in a hurry. On the first morning we only had hot water available so unable to shower. At the breakfast table my colleague had a cockroach crawling up his shirt. No internet in the bedroom, only in small area in the lobby. Staff completely reactive, unprofessional and not a single excuse or acknowledgement was uttered. My colleague told me this morning that there was NO water available in the hotel today. THIS IS THE HOTEL FROM HELL so pls avoid it like the plague. I struggle to understand how this hotel is allowed to operate in the first place and it should never have been recommended to us via the Barcelona Business Pass Website. EMZ, March 2nd 2012.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I have stayed in last 20 years”
Reviews.Author: AdyMoores999
Reviews.Content: There are no redeaming features of this hotel. Initially I stayed in tower 2 in room 328 on my first morning in shower the hot water tank exploded above me, I escaped but entire room flooded under 4 inches of water flowing out of room into lift shaft. I had to demand another room to finish my shower, I received zero apology from the hotel - the reception staff are the worst mannered people you will ever come accross .... Wifi only works in cramped reception area when moved from 3 star tower 2 to 1 star tower 1 you realise this hotel was built in the 70's and has same decor today. It is rumoured to be changing its name shortly - please if it wasn't so awful it would have been funny. No hot water this list goes on - please don't let this hotel spoil your stay in one of the most wonderful cities in the world

Reviews.Title: “Cheap but not so cheerful”
Reviews.Author: UtxiGirona
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of the location as we were going to a concert at Palau Sant Jordi and the price was very reasonable. The lady on reception was very friendly and offered us an interior room or one with a balcony. We mistakenly chose one with a balcony which was on the front and turned out to be very noisy. The room itself was very basic and could have done with minor repairs and painting, but it was clean. The bathroom door stuck from the inside which could have been a problem for a single person in the room. We opted not to have breakfast. On checking out and paying our bill, the two gentlemen on reception were more interested in talking between themselves. To be honest you get what you pay for with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate but be prepared for a basic facility”
Reviews.Author: Katbell
Reviews.Content: We were a bit anxious before arrival having read mixed reviews about this hotel, however we needn't have worried - it was ok really. The underground secure parking was ideal for our motortrikes, but getting to it was quite difficult as the surrounding roads were so frantically busy even at 9pm! We could see the hotel, just couldn't find anywhere on street to stop in order to run in and get directions for the car park! Staff on reception were helpful and sorted out an error in our booking without a great fuss. The beds were clean and we did not find them uncomfy, the bathroom fittings were not terribly new and the shower head would not stay on the wall but there was lots of hot water and the toilet flushed so we managed ok. We had air con which was a bonus as apart from cooling us it also prevented us hearing 'people' noise but our friends had no air con so had a disturbed night. We had asked for a quiet room and were given this - it overlooked a courtyard. At breakfast we realised what a big hotel this is. This was breakfast on a huge scale and not particularly relaxing. The food was fairly basic and some people had to share tables. Supplies of juice etc kept running out and there was a short delay while supplies were replenished. On the plus side, this hotel is close to the ferries and main motorways out of Barcelona so it met our needs, even if it was the most basic hotel we stayed in during our 3 week tour.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price”
Reviews.Author: CharlotteOlsson
Reviews.Content: Me and my friend shared a room with twin beds. We had a big balcony and it was a big room. The WC was unfortunately small and not very smart designed. Extremely small shower. The breakfast was just 'ok'. Overall, I think it's a good hotel for the money you pay. Very good location!

Reviews.Title: “Auto Hogar - Never Again”
Reviews.Author: Philip C
Reviews.Content: What can I say about the Auto Hogar. We had real reservations about this hotel before we arrived in Barcelona after reading some of the reviews on here. First the good points, its cheap (for the location) and is a 10 min walk to La Rambla. The staff were friendly and helpful. Bed linen and towels changed daily. Now the bad. Our room was tiny and very cramped, the wall adjacent to the bathroom had damp patches, the air con didnt work, the door frame was rotten, the shower head snapped off on first use (they did replace it promptly though), very noisy (didnt bother us though), the breakfast area is a cattle market and you will have to share a table with other guests. The food was quite poor quality also. Conclusion, if you're looking for somewhere cheap and don't mind all of the above then go for it, if you're looking for a bit more quality then avoid at all costs. In a weird short of way the pkace does grow on you the longer you stay, after all its just a base to see the city.

Reviews.Title: “BORING AND RUBBISH”
Reviews.Author: djslusj
Reviews.Content: i will never recommend this hotel for anyone! my mother had bought the tickets for my eighteenth birthday, so i couldn't complain much to her, but she was SCAMMED for her money by order rooms at this hotel i can tell you. air con had black spots around then, rooms were smelly, breakfast was poor and boring, the staff almost didn't speak english so we had to find out everything by ourselves, even when the taxi we had ordered the day before we were going home they couldn't help us because the didn't understand ANYTHING we said! outside the hotell it reeked of urin, bathroom was disgusting (i washed my hair at a hairdresser every day, which was bloody expencive), i was bitten during the night even when we didn't have the window open, and i had to freeze to death every night because i couldn't use the wool blankets, cus' they were covered in mysterious brown spots. im happy we were so lucky with the weather, because i wouldn't stay in there if it was raining. barcelona had much to offer, but this hotel was discraseful.

Reviews.Title: “el-gabban london- barcelona, september 2011”
Reviews.Author: El-Gabban
Reviews.Content: After reading dreadful reviews in Trip Adviser about the Auto Hogar Hotel,we seriously considered cancelling the booking we had made months ago.On arrival,we were pleasantly surprised to find friendly, helpful staff on Reception and throughout the hotel. Our air-conditioned room was comfortable & clean - linen was changed daily. The buffet breakfast had plenty of everything to suit everyones taste - including very good coffee and bottles of chilled mineral water. We are sure we would not have received better service at any of the nearby four star hotels. We would recommend this hotel to anyone and are looking forward to another visit next year.

Reviews.Title: “Barcelona Auto Hogar”
Reviews.Author: peter_daniell
Reviews.Content: Hotel basic but adequate. We had a vey noisy night when woman next door went ballistic at 2.00 am. She was asked to leave then all was quiet. Breakfast was OK, continental, yogurts, baked beans, fried eggs. A couple of bars right next door were you can get basic meals. 10 min walk from Ramblas where drinks are very expensive. Place de Reail just off the ramblas has some very nice restaurants but still a little pricey. Bought 2 day bus pass and did both hop on hop off tours. Gaudi attractions well worth visiting as is Camp nou home off Barcelona fotball club. Sagria Familia was amazing but did not leave the bus when we saw the queue for the entry to the cathedral & the queue to get back on the bus. Did the cable car to the top om mount Juc. The braver of you can do the cable car ride across the bay up to the top. The bus tickets give you vouchers for 10% of most of these attractions which can soon mount up if you visit them all. Very near underground station if you prefer to get around that way. If you want a hairdryer, as my wife found out, they want a large deposit. TV had no remote, i guess that prob needed a deposit as well, but I was not htere to watch spaanish tv.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but Clean”
Reviews.Author: NiamhOCIreland
Reviews.Content: Myself and my boyfriend stayed in this hotel for 7nights. We were in what is called the 'old part' located above the carpark. After reading the reviews I was worried what we would find upon arrival but was pleasantly surprised with the room. The room was very big, sleeping area and seating area, but had two single beds. Instead of fussing we just pushed the beds together as we arrived very late and just wanted to sleep, we decided it wasn't worth changing room for. The bathroom was clean, the staff were very friendly and helpful and the location was excellent. Las Ramblas is 10mins walk away at most, the metro stop is just outside the door and the cafe next door has a great selection of food. For what we paid we were very happy.

Reviews.Title: “ABSOLUTELY RUBBISH”
Reviews.Author: Lukas P
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 4 nights. The aircondition system was not working and the room was extremely hot, plus humit and noise. Tv had no remote control, tha lift and the bathroom was old and smelling awfull. People at the reception was not kind at all and it was difficult to communicate with them since nobody speaks a foreign language. They charged 1 euro for 6 minutes internet connection and 22 euros for parking our bicycles!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is getting better and better”
Reviews.Author: Prince91
Reviews.Content: This was the second time I have been in this hotel. Location is rather good – short walk to the major attractions. In the proximity there are a lot of restaurants. First time I was there in January 2009 mostly because of the price – cheaper than hostel, so I decided to go there again with my family. We booked two rooms and as we wanted to be close, we got 2 out of 5 newly refurbished rooms. This hotel has 2 stars but I believe it will be changed went the renovation is finished. Rooms are spacey, complimentary kits are really nice. Bathrooms have great showers for relaxing after whole day of sightseeing. The only disadvantage of the hotel is breakfast – they offer only sugar. Everything is sweet and cheese is vegetable substitution.

Reviews.Title: “well located Barcelone”
Reviews.Author: chalet007155032
Reviews.Content: Clean room , clean Bathroom , breakfeast included OK . Next door to the Metro . basic standard room OK for couple of day at a affordable price . The location is the main asset of this Hotel 15 minutes walking to Place D'espagne , 10 minutes walking to the Rambla & the Gohtic Quarter by the way the Gothic quarter is the place you want to go for good Tapas & shopping & walking & resto , Ramblas street a bit to commercial for me . Over haul Hotel OK, location very good , price OK . Martin Joanne & friend / from Canada . Enjoy walking the city . note > very good public transport ..

Reviews.Title: “Okay for the prize”
Reviews.Author: AnniEsben
Reviews.Content: We think that the hotel is quite okay and the prize for staying there was really good. The room was big, how ever there was not much funitures - and hardly any place to put your clothes. We like the area, but at night there is lot of noize.

Reviews.Title: “Just plain and nice for a sightseeing trip”
Reviews.Author: kostasno
Reviews.Content: Centrally located hotel. 10 minutes walk from start of the Ramblas and sea-side (Maremagnum). Metro stop almost outside the hotel's door (Line 3- which leaves you among others to Placa Catalunya, Placa Espanya, metro stops on the Ramblas such as Liceu and Drassanes). Got a twin room on the side of the road (Av. Paral.lel) with a very nice balcony. Room was very spacious- especially for the european standards. The room had 2 relatively small beds, a table with 2 chairs, a desk with a mirror and a closet. It was kept clean (except for under the beds which was a little dusty) and the beds were made every day. As the hotel is centrally located there was noise from the road with the window open, but when closed it was reduced a lot (soundproof). After all the room is air-conditioned. No free wi-fi (which I knew, but I find "cheap" for any hotel to lack). Bathroom was good except for the shower curtain which was old and stuck (in other rooms might be better). Receptionists were nice and english-speaking and there was luggage storage to keep your luggage after check-out.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal perfect hotel for bunch of lads”
Reviews.Author: Bobcat81
Reviews.Content: Cannot understand the reviews of this place on here. The hotel is nothing special and fantastic and anybody who thinks they'd get special and fantastic for 40 euro a night in the middle of the summer in Barcelona is delusional. The hotel is dead central. Its very clean. Staff are fine. I dont know what mroe u can want. The showers are v powrful and the rooms are fine, basic of course but absolutely ideal. Bed is clean, shower is great, additional bed clothes pillows all provided, cleaned by cleaners each day, its perfect. Ok this sin't somewhere for a happy newly married couple to go to be blown away but for people who aren't fussy, this place is ideal. Location fantastic and its clean and not dodgy. Would definitely recomend it, we went for a stag and it was absolutely 100% ideal.

Reviews.Title: “don't believe what you read”
Reviews.Author: jvsChicago_Illinois
Reviews.Content: no airconditioning terrible breakfast no real "guest" services -- took 2 days to get the shower fixed wonderful location -- especially if you get a room off the street. The street is very noisy 24/7 and without airconditioning, you will want to have the window open.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here!!”
Reviews.Author: alirud
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel as part of 6 day trip - 2 nights Barcelona/4 nights cruise on Royal Caribbean ship. Not cheapest holiday we've ever done - 6 star ship - no star hotel!! Reception ok - staff friendly and helpful but miserable room overlooking busiest main road (6 lanes!!) in city. No sleep for two nights - breakfast awful - couldn't wait to leave. Have complained to travel company - contrast between hotel and ship too much!

Reviews.Title: “Joke of a hotel - worst experience ever!”
Reviews.Author: IrishItaliano
Reviews.Content: Words cannot describe how awful this hotel is. I stayed here for 3 nights with my boyfriend and only that we were staying with friends, we would have changed hotel after the first night. To access our room from the reception, we had to cross through a garage before heading up several flights of stairs (the lifts were never free). The general condition of the hotel and common areas is filthy. This hotel has a 70's style decor and clearly has been renovated since the 70's. On entering our room we were instantly hit with the smell of stale cigarette smoke. Added to this was the fact that there were two single beds, although we had booked a double room. We immediately expressed our dissatisfaction to the reception desk and they changed our room. The second room was not much better. There was still an odour of stale smoke but it was slightly better than the previous room. This room was very small and had one tiny room about the size of a computer screen which looked onto a tiny covered courtyard and with a view into the neighbouring rooms. There was zero light in the room, even in the daytime. The bathroom had an awful damp odour and smelled like the sewers. There was a tiny television with no remote control and that you had to strain your neck to watch as it was so high up. There was no point evening trying to sleep in this hotel. The sheets were old looking and there was only one long pillow between two of us. We could hear everything going on in the surrounding rooms, couples fighting, babies crying and even a guy snoring in his sleep! On top of that there was the sound of water running through the drains, it sounded like it was raining all the time. At about 4 am when trying to sleep, a bunch of teenagers were running through the corridors of the hotel screaming and banging on doors. The breakfast was a joke - plastic wrapped croissants and awful coffee, i'll say no more. I would strongly discourage people from staying here. The Auto Hogar doesn't even deserve to call itself a hotel. I'm sure there are many hotels, even hostels in Barcelona for less expensive where you could find a much better quality of accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Not for those who look for luxury”
Reviews.Author: Daniela0105
Reviews.Content: The hotel had a good location near the Rambla, and the metro station is just outside the door. But it is also situated on a very busy and noisy street, so if you are a light sleeper and sensitive for city noise, you should pick another hotel. The breakfast was okay, but quite limited. Positive was the parking hall, which became very handy when we had a rental car. The cleaning worked perfectly and the room was cleaned every day and the towels were changed. We are siblings, young, but more out for sights and good food than party, and for us this hotel was okay, as long as you don't have high expectations. The room was big and had i big balcony, but the hotel is run down, and there is nothing extra. A big minus for only one power socket in the room, and that one was situated by the tv, up in the ceiling. So we had to charge 2 phones, 2 cameras, Tom-Tom etc at the one socket that we had in the toilet. You need to have a good sense of humor to stay at this hotel. Double glazing would not be a bad idea for this hotel....

Reviews.Title: “Worst ever”
Reviews.Author: BlaBa4
Reviews.Content: Me and my friend was booking a dubble room 4 months in advance but when we arrived to the hotel at the evening they told us it had been some problem and they didnt have any dubble room for us. So then they told us we could get a singleroom to share on or get a room on some other hotel at our own for our own money. So there we lived for 3 days in a singleroom with a 110-120 cm bed and we are two men in 20 years! And for this we didnt get any money back or anything else! Easy the worst hotel ever!

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare”
Reviews.Author: Geoo-c
Reviews.Content: My advice would be stay clear from this hotel at all costs, the decor is grubby, the food is terrible, the rooms small, dirty, noisy, and need severe upgrading. The hotel actually looks ok from the front and the reception area looks fine, however it is only when you proceed to the rooms through an enclosed carparking area you realise what a big mistake.The noise levels are a big problem in this hotel due to the way the hotel is constructed. You can even hear footsteps on several floors above. Our room was located next to a noisy lift which operated 24/7. We complained on arrival due to the noise and the state of the rooms. We were given another room, just as bad, eventually we checked out early and booked into a far cleaner hotel down the road, well wort it.

Reviews.Title: “For the price there are other options”
Reviews.Author: PriAssahida
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located near a metro station, near las ramblas but the structure is poor, lack of maintanance and old. The breakfast is too busy and ok nothing much... for the price we pay if we could choose we could go for a better place... I could hear the voices next door and was afraid of using the elevator because it was so small that it could only take 2 person at a time!!!

Reviews.Title: “OK considering the location/price”
Reviews.Author: ViiviK
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was very basic budget room, old furniture as always. However it was clean so no complaints there. The aircon was a bit odd, the room became very hot (it was not because of the weather as it was October) at some point and finally managed to cool it down by opening the window. It however heated up again at some stage, so constant battle. The location is good and the reason for choosing this place. We did not intend to spend much time in the hotel room so it was perfect for us. RIght next to Parallel metro station, walking distance to Ramblas. Great restaurants near by (not the touristic ones on Parallel but if you go inside the barrio between Montjuic and Parallel)

Reviews.Title: “Service in the restaurant is disgusting”
Reviews.Author: Miromura
Reviews.Content: We were staying at another local restaurant and this hotels restaurant's food seemed appealing. However they have a lot of hidden charges they don't tell you about when ordering. They asked us if we liked bread and cheese and having gone to another place prior to out visit here the bread and cheese was given as a complimentary item. They charged us 10 euros for literally 1 slice of bread and 2 slices of cheese. Also, we asked for a side of fries, which they charged 8.50 euros for. Considering the lasagne was 7 euros this was shocking! Lesson: don't go here and ask about even the simplest things they try to offer you. Also assume fries will cost a bomb too! When we complained the waiter who claimed he was the manager said he didn't care and was extremely rude. When I told him his attitude "sucked" he said "thank you, I don't care". I was stunned as we were out for a simple lunch. He didn't even offer us complimentary dessert or offer to change the bill to accommodate us since they didn't tell us about the bread and cheese charge. They simply didn't care. It's a 2* hotel and restaurant, what do you expect! But their mannerisms are also 2*. Astonishing! Don't go here. Go elsewhere if you're on a budget, at least where they have staff with decent attitudes.

Reviews.Title: “A decent 2* hotel”
Reviews.Author: Aldo45
Reviews.Content: The greatest advantage is the position of the hotel - it takes you about 10 minutes by walking to get to Las Ramblas. Another good thing is that in the front of the hotel you have acces to the subway (Parallel) and also to the funicular that takes you to Montjuic. The first night we got a very small room with view from inside areea (the garrage let's say) but the receptionist said that he will change it for us the next day, which he did. The other room was much better, bigger and with street view. The only bad thing was that the window did not close so well, but we got used after 3 days. The room was clean and the bathroom was ok. Well, the restaurant for the breakfast is pretty big but seems to be crowded almost all the time. There were at least 3 times when we shared our table with other tourists but there was not such a big deal. One NOT so good thing was that we had the same food every breakfast and we spent 12 days in Barcelona. I would call this hotel DECENT because we are talking about a 2* do not forget. If you want a better one you can choose a 3*, but beware that in the end of march (when we've been to Barcelona) the prices were kinda high (more than 70 euro for a 3* hotel so...).

Reviews.Title: “would not recommend”
Reviews.Author: pooleBergerac
Reviews.Content: Good position although VERY noisy, terrible breakfast, very scruffy bathroom

Reviews.Title: “never again”
Reviews.Author: rebeccadobson
Reviews.Content: I was booked into Auto Hogar through Holiday Collection group which said i would be in a 4 star hotel, it is far from this. Firstly holiday collection group lied about this and said nothing could be done unless i wanted to pay to upgrade myself into another hotel(after i had already paid the price of a 4 star hotel) which i couldnt afford so had to stick with this booking. The hotel is in a noisy dirty part of barcelona although only a 5 minute walk to Port Vell which is very nice. The rooms were not clean, mould in the bath/shower and no shower curtains so the bathroom becomes flooded. No soaps, shampoos and even though there were 2 guests we only received one bath towel. The breakfast supplied is very basic and to use the internet is 9 euro for an hour. I saw atleast 3 cockroaches scuttling around the very old building and the beds are fold outs so very uncomfortable to sleep in. The reception staff were mildly helpful and overall the worst hotel experience i have had. Not a happy customer.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of room 109 - every staff member knows why”
Reviews.Author: EuropeanCities
Reviews.Content: If you don't mind having 3 air condition machines, that turn on and off, one after the other, just outside the window that cannot close, and if you don't mind listening to the staff's unkept promises, this is the place to be.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate but not impressive”
Reviews.Author: CasperSeingTheWorld
Reviews.Content: If you travel on a low budget, maybe you are students like the two of us, Hotel Auto Hogar is recommendable - but be aware! It is cheap and the reception/cleaning staff is helpful. We e-mailled the hotel a couple of times and luckely our request of a nice room was granted. We stayed in a room with balcony - which was a lifesaver. The hotel was allright for crashing in bed after a long day but no more than that. Our room was rather large - most rooms there are smaller. Our experience was that the beds were quite bad, the room was old and kind of dirty (allthough cleaned every day) and worst of all the FREE breakfast was horrible. If you consider this hotel because of the price - please be aware that the included breakfast is'nt worth paying for anyway! Also DO NOT dine at the café located next to the hotel (in the same building), the food was average, but the service was horrible - and they cheated my girlfriend and I so bad! We had to pay for food to about EIGHT persons allthough we were only two - just because of a waiters poor english and they were very rude (made my girl cry!) The best thing about the hotel is the location - walking distance to the centre and for some the beach as well. In addition there is Metro/Subway and busses very nearby. But there is also a "but" - the street Avinguda De Parallel is VERY noisy - so it can be difficult to sleep. All in all - recommendable for low budget and wise travellers - but no more than that. I said yes in the "recommendation box" below - but this really depends on your situation.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Flr071
Reviews.Content: We choose this hotel because the price for room was not too expensive, it has a good position - in central area :) ! In the end we didn`t regret our option! What was more than pleasant was the staff, they were incredible, helpful and always smiling!

Reviews.Title: “A bad choice”
Reviews.Author: Eugenem21
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated close to several of Barcelona's attractions, not very far from the port and the city center, next to a metro station. The rooms are very small without recent renovations. We had some problems with the shower which was not working properly and the TV was not working also. It was a strange feeling when we had to go through the garage in order to reach our room from the reception lobby, Another inconvenient was that you could hear the noises from the hall as there weren't any walls. The breakfast was OK.

Reviews.Title: “Tired and dirty hotel. Would not recommend”
Reviews.Author: Golcarite
Reviews.Content: Never posted a review before but the quality( or lack of it) of this hotel deserves a warning note to other tourists. Location excellent but rooms are dirty and old.paper thin walls- poor beds. Nothing nice to say about the room. Barcelona however is great and highly recommended- just do not stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Tired hotel in need of care.”
Reviews.Author: johnsma
Reviews.Content: If you want a budget hotel and can put up with a very tired and worn out establishment then this is for you. The hotel is very old and in need of renovation. The rooms are tired with rusty baths and in our case, a basin hanging off the wall. The hotel fronts one of the main road traffic junctions so traffic noise is constant 24 hours a day and as the old glazing is loose, there is no sound proofing. You can also here the exploits of your neighbouring rooms as the walls are thin. Breakfast is a bit of a scramble as there are not enough places for everyone and food runs out constantly. but if you are patient, you will get what you require. We found the staff helpful and apologetic about the state of the hotel. The rooms do not resemble the marketing pictures on the web. Nevertheless, if you want a cheap hotel that is close to the centre and you can sleep through anything.......

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, clean rooms, cheap hotel, quirky lifts but can be noisy.”
Reviews.Author: EnglandCrunch
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed the stay in the hotel although after viewing several bad reviews was a bit apprehensive. Breakfast was limited choice but no problems with queues after getting there early. Nice views of Barcelona from room. Convenient location with easy access to metro, Montjuic, Las Ramblas and Port Vell.

Reviews.Title: “Suited me fine ( Tough Im Not Fussy!! )”
Reviews.Author: lon1971
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel while taking part in the Barcelona Marathon.. My room was small but ok altough walls were like paper....Didnt sleep very much because of noise coming from old victorian lift and hall.. Its location is excellent beside metro and regular bus route and 5 minutes walk from Las Ramblas. Found staff to be helpful, room was cleaned daily, breakfast ok and overall for the money it cost me for my stay was fine. For a single traveller its fine but I definately would not be staying there for a romantic weekend

Reviews.Title: “Moldy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jgb9530
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very small and there was mold growing on the outside of our room. A huge patch of dark mold that nobody cared to clean or worry about even after we told them about the problem. Not a good experience!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location thats all”
Reviews.Author: blossomtoes
Reviews.Content: booked around April 2009. looked ok nice reception are but when they said go through the garage to get to the rooms a bit concerned. there were 14 of us. the room we had was furnished with twin beds a wardrobe and 2 chairs. it was basic very basic, not too noisy for us but the other had noise problems. the breakfst was not to write home about. great for getting to Las Ramblas,Marina etc. not the best i've stayed in nor the worst actually but expected better.

Reviews.Title: “Three different rooms in one weekend. The place is a joke”
Reviews.Author: candyNorthampton
Reviews.Content: me and my friend had this hotel booked since last year we had been travelling that day since 1pm and arrived at the hotel very late.when we checked in the girl said that the room we booked which was a twin would not be avalible untill the following morning i wasnt at all happy she had a double room for us so we agreed we would take it we went to get the lift as we were staying on the fifth floor only to find the lift wasnt working at that time it took well over half a hour to get it fixed we got to are room and as we opened the door i was not happy the bed was so small not sutible for two adults and the room was very very small so no messing i was straight on the phone to reception and told them to come upstairs and sort us another room as this is ridiculous we were given a room each on the other side of the building you have to go through the car park to grt to this i didnt feel at all safe when i got to this part of the building the room was on a little courtyard and you could smell the drains and the constant noise from the lift and the walls are so thin you can hear everything the bathroom was so small if you were a larger person you would have to jump over the toilet to get into the shower when on the toilet you have the wall bang in front of your facethe net morning we went for breakfast there was a big queue all down the stairs when we did get in you were put with other people to eat your breakfast you wasnt asked if you was ok with this you had no choice the breakfaszt was ok and met some nice people we then returned to are room and again took the baggage back to reception and they stored are cases untill the room was availible the hotel is NOTwhat it looks like in the brochure its BADLY needs a good paint and tiles in the bathroom are broke and dirty the curtains where all ripped in the bedroom the photos they show you must be from another hotel as this is a BIG LET DOWN the area the only good thing is how close you are to the metro las ramblas the zoo and beggers and porno palace just round the corner i wouldt feel safe here on my own we eventully got are twin room with balcony which was great but that should have been ready the day we arrived very BAD MANAGEMENT WOULD NOT RECCOMENED THIS HOTEL TO MY WORST ENEMY

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: Kemuli
Reviews.Content: I was travelling with my boy 5 y.o. Our flight was cancelled and our travelling company offered us to stay in this hotel for the extra night. When we got there, I had to pay for the use of the internet to get the hotel voucher from my e-mail !!!!!! I´ve travelled a lot, but never been in a hotel like this. And never before I´ve met this kind of behaviour from the hotel staff. Although this only a two star hotel, but anyway ! The next morning there were so many people going to have a breakfest that there were no room for us. About 30 persons in line waiting for the breakfast. Had a breakfast in the cafe nearby. In the back yard there were at least two air- conditiong machines that kept quite a noise !! The walls between the rooms were paper. Sorry if my english isn´t that good. I just wanted to tell my opinion on this hotel. Avoid this hotel if you can! There are lots other hotels in Barcelona. Horror place really. I dont normally write these comments but in this case I had to. Barcelona is still a great city. T.Kemppainen - Finland

Reviews.Title: “There are better places than this”
Reviews.Author: Lukasta
Reviews.Content: This hotel is definately not worth the price. The decor is very old and rooms are in bad condition. On the plus side - good breakfast, and nice and helpfull staff. We saw better hotels in better location in Barcelona and cheaper than this one.

Reviews.Title: “basic but does the job”
Reviews.Author: 050810a
Reviews.Content: The hotel is basic but the rooms are functional- when you think, you are in Barcelona- you're not gonna spend your holiday in the room, are you?! As some other reviewers said, it is a bit loud and that can be a bit distracting. The breakfast is great but we were warned that pickpockets operate in the breakfast room! The staff were nice and let me practice my Spanish with them. It was reasonably priced for BCN and a 10 min walk from all the attractions, however, you do have to pass through a dodgy street full of prosititutes n pimps so I wouldn't recommend this hotel for a single woman.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here!!”
Reviews.Author: irisheyes3110
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here for 3 nights, and by a country mile was the worst hotel experience of my life! Don't get me wrong, prior to booking the hotel i read numerous reviews which seemed on the whole quite positive for a 2* hotel. But to be honest, this should not even get a 1* rating, have stayed in hostels in my younger days a lot better than Auto Hogar. From the moment we arrived the staff were rude, like we were a nuicance to them having to check in! Then the room as tiny, dirty and smelt of sewage, along with the paper thin walls and you can hear every footstep on the corridor. There was no TV in the room when we arrived, i mentioned it to the receptionist who seemed shocked that there was no tv & that they would arrange to have one installed. That never materialised over the 3 days we were staying there. When we came back to our room on the second day we got not get in as the key would not work, so the receptonist had a go and could not open it either, and then the cleaner who also had a go could also not open the room. After 30 mins of this the receptionist walked off, leaving me and my partner in the corridor, and when i asked him ehere he was going he said to call maintainance to come. I asked him how long this would take, and he said because it was a saturday evening it would be about 1 hour! I then asked him if he had any intention of telling us that it would take this long, and he shrugged his shoulders and carried on walking away! So, we immediately went to reception to wait as there were couches, and literally 2 minutes after getting there the receptionist told us the room was now open! Very suspicious to say the least, as we all tried for 30 mins withour success trying to open the room, and as soon as we leave the corridor it opens! Cheked all our belongings as soon as we got into the room to make sure all in order. The restaurant staff were some of the rudest people I have ever come accross, especially one chap in particular who would shout and agressively speak to guests, demanding them not to sit anywhere until told where to sit, and I saw a number of guests complain. On one of the mornings, we waited to be seated, and the waiter saw us waiting but carried to joke with his colleagues , looking over at us ever now and again. After 5 mins we went to take a table ourselves (the restaurant was empty at the time!) as the waiter would not come over, and as soon as we moved to do so then he moved quickly to us shouting what do we think we are doing, and not to sit until he tells us! Incredible to witness this, almost unbelieveable. And if you were to ask for anything the waiters would just grunt and basically not assist. I am not the type of person to complain about anything, but I am making an exception on this occassion as Hotel Hogar is an absolute disgrace, and just hope that others reading this will not make the same mistake as we did.

Reviews.Title: “Oh my god!”
Reviews.Author: Jorch67
Reviews.Content: Please! do avoid this hotel!! Everything is old and dirty and pictures in internet site is very "smooth & clean" considering the ugly truth! Hotel is located in very busy and noisy(!) street and sound insulation is VERY POOR. You can hear everything what happens in the street to the 4th floor with no problem. Walls between rooms are thin like paper and if neibourgh goes to shower in the very earl morning (like 5:11 like our next door did...) that will be your wakeup call. Toilet and shower is kind of clean but there is weird smell and shower is so small that normal sized (180/85) guy does not fit there. Do not spoil your vacation by using this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Good location..”
Reviews.Author: Awilke
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Auto Hogar for 3 nights. The location is great, less than a minute away from the tube stop Paral.lel, walking distance to Las Ramblas, the harbour etc.. The room we had was very simple and clean, towels were changed every day and the heating worked well..We had a room on the 5th floor, facing the back, looking over Barcelona, which was quiet nice.. It was a bit old and the bathroom may need some refurbishing, but it was still ok and clean. The rooms are not very good isolated, you can hear everything from the room next door or the corridor..If you are tall, ask for a Queen bed as you may not fit in the single bed.. The breakfast was good. You can have cereals, toast or cup cakes etc in the morning and the buffet was always filled up again. I would definately stay there again if I return to Barcelona..

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value - clean and centrally situated”
Reviews.Author: PaulrSunderland
Reviews.Content: Cheap and cheerful and central. No complaints at all

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: m_mayhs
Reviews.Content: From Outside this hotel looks decent but once inside the rooms are very standard. Breakfast is nice. Shower is brilliant.. But rooms tend to get really hot so we had to keep window open. For the money you pay this is ok.

Reviews.Title: “Compact”
Reviews.Author: Yorkshiremoors
Reviews.Content: The rooms are rather on the small side, with some of them facing onto an interior 'courtyard' where you can here the toilets being flushed. The location though is good being close to Las Ramblas and the harbour. The breakfast is good though sometimes you have to queue for breakfast. The attached café serves a lovely seafood soup.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad”
Reviews.Author: plughead
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised at the cleanliness of the hotel. staff were helpful, we had to travel through the carperk, but all uncover and well lit. Rooms were basic, but clean, shower worked, outside noise not to bad, faced onto some sort of school opposite. room walls were thin though heard everything next door said, though they were a bit loud. Breakfast was ok, helpful staff and friendly. Restaurant next door sold good meals cheaply compared to outside hotel. all in all not a bad experience, you only need the room for sleeping and shaowering, so was a good 3 day stay for us.

Reviews.Title: “not bad”
Reviews.Author: keithstu
Reviews.Content: was apprehensive after reading reviews, but here is my experience, ok its not 5 star but what do you expect for a budget hotel, rooms were clean, basic and not bad at all for the money. location is fantastic, really excellant. rooms were a good size and cleaned daily. beds were ok quite comfy noise on first night was terrible, but partly dues to thin walls, after first night no major problem. you get what you pay for and in consideration of this its not a bad place to stay at all

Reviews.Title: “NEVER AGAIN!!”
Reviews.Author: Disappointed93
Reviews.Content: This "hotel" should close down for a few months and upgrade. The whole place, including the staff who look miserable, are in desperate need of a change. First impression of the lobby wasn't too bad, although there was a really strong smell of air freshener. The bedroom was a joke - I have bigger closets at home! A double bed, wardrobe and desk had been squeezed into a tiny space with a view from the window of air conditioning units. The bathroom taps were rusted onto the sink and bath, and the towels were stained. There was a distinct damp smell which they had tried to disguise with air freshener. The hot breakfast consisted of hot dog sausages and beans and warm liquid they claimed was coffee. There was a cold selection which was slightly better with croissants, boiled eggs, cold meats and cereal. The noise throughout the night was incredible with guests coming and going. The only thing this hotel has going for it is the location. Thank goodness we had only booked one night - that was enough!

Reviews.Title: “What a dump!”
Reviews.Author: scottishannieBurnley
Reviews.Content: We thankfully only spent one night in this "hotel" before flying back to England. The room faced a wall where air con units were situated. The room window didn't open which was probably as well as the noise was bad enough with the window closed. The paint was peeling off the bedroom wall and the bathroom door wouldn't close. The "coffee" served with breakfast was unbelievable. The only thing it had in common with coffee was the colour! Noise went on throughout the night with doors opening and closing and other guests talking at the tops of their voices. The plus side was that it was handy for the harbour and Las Ramblas, though it is situated in a slightly dodgy area. Don't go there. The photos on their web site must have been taken elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “Fab location and good cheap hotel”
Reviews.Author: BritainCitygirl
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews myself and 3 freinds were terrified, but upon ariving we were pleasently suprised. The hotel has a great location just 5-10 min walk from la ramabla and really ahndy for the port. We found the staff friendly and approachable and went a lightbulb went in our room they came and fixed it straight away even though it was 3am. The rooms were tidy, clean and basic but had everything you would need, hairdrier, mirror, etc. The maid came every day and changed bedding and towels and there was always hot water. The only slight complaint I have is that the acoustic are not great and you do hear other people coming and going, but at least this ensures you ont sleep in on a morning, we were never woken up late at night. Overall we had a really great stay at Hogar and I would definintly go again, Barcelona is such an amazing city you are hardly in your room, so for 2 stars and the very cheap price we paid, I thing the hotel was fab, very good value for money and top location. Would recomend to all.

Reviews.Title: “noisy”
Reviews.Author: jackik
Reviews.Content: The service was very good, but unfortunately the hotel was on a busy street which was very noisy with the window open and stifling with the window closed. We also chose the wrong week to go when Barcelona won the football (no sleep that night)!!! The great thing was, it was close to the metro, and harbour in fact all the attractions were only a 15-30 minute walk or ride away. The room was very basic and quite small. but it did the trick.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Hotel, please dont stay here”
Reviews.Author: gyster
Reviews.Content: This hotel was absolutely terrible, from the moment we got there. I booked this 9 months in advanced which was already paid for and due to our flights being cancelled we got there a day late. I informed them by phone to let them know and they said that it was fine. We arrived the following day and they said that they had cancelled our 2 days that we had booked, so we had to pay for that night and there was no accomodation for the following night as they were fully booked so we had to find another place. They didnt even refund our money, even though they were in the wrong. Not to mention the breakfast was terrible along with the room. I highly recommend you find somewhere else to stay, as the staff were also very unhelpful.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny very dark rooms. Nosiy hotel”
Reviews.Author: derammy
Reviews.Content: We've just spent 3 days in Barcelona and 2 nights in this hotel. After reading some of the reviews of the hotel I was expecting it to be horrible, and when we got there we just confirmed that is a horrible place. In order to get to the rooms you need to pass a parking (yes, there is a parking between the reception area and the rooms.) The room was tiny, with no natural light whatsoever. So even during the day we had to turn the lights on if we wanted to see each other. It had a very small window that was facing another building that was just 2 metres away. The walls are really thin, so you can hear EVERYTHING, specially in the morning when the cleaners stars to "clean". The only positive thing about this hotel is the location and that it's that bad that you always prefer to be outside :).

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money and great location.”
Reviews.Author: liswend
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews for this hotel prior to our visit we were a bit concerned as what to expect. However, we were presently suprised. The location is fantastic - plenty of bars outside the hotel with friendly staff and about 10mins walk from las ramblas. Yes, the rooms are basic, but clean and functional, the maid came in every day - if you are expecting the Ritz do not book a 2 star hotel in the first place! A great base to see the sights of Barcelona. We were two women travelling alone and did not feel intimidated at any point during our stay. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for cheap and comfortable accommodation as a good base to discover this beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “Dont stay at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: madscousebiker
Reviews.Content: I have previously stayed at this hotel last year and was pleased with the service. We stayed in Barcelona again in June this year for the motorcycle grand prix and again booked the Auto Hogar, we were allocated a room at the back of the hotel on the first floor, which overlooked the service road to local bars and restaurants. the glass in the windows was opaque and the curtains hanging off the rail, the shower did not work neither did the air conditioning The constant noise and I mean constant from Bin trucks all day and night, groups of young people using the road as a cut through at all hours of the day and night and the opportunity to open the windows about an inch meant extreme heat in the room at all times. The service staff at the hotel pay no regard to the fact that you are a paying guest and add to the noise by constantly slamming doors and shouting constantly, I am actually english with a very good grasp of the spanish language and not deaf. A request to move rooms was met by apologies by the staff as the hotel was full, I am glad we only had to endure this very poor service for a couple of days. Oh I haven`t mentioned the extremely rude and ignorant restaurant staff at the breakfast restaurant, one of whom came very close to being punched into next week due to his arrogant and ignorant comments to my wife, note to waiter dont speak in spanish mate when the english guy can understand you. Words were had with him and the management, in both languages Barcelona is a beautiful city as are the majority of the people, but to describe this hotel as three star is completely unnaceptable, I have stayed in Hostals in this area which were cleaner, staffed by better more helpful staff. This hotel is at best a one star rated Hostal and I strongly recommend you stay elsewhere. The choice is yours mine will be to avoid this place like the plague in future and stay somewhere that the staff value paying guests. I have contacted the hotel management with my comments and demanded a refund. One Irate Motorcycling Scouser

Reviews.Title: “keep well away”
Reviews.Author: amccole2000
Reviews.Content: My husband and i have just returned from a depressing 3 night stay at this hotel.I admit to having chosen it because of its ideal location and price range but boy was i sorry.As soon as i opened the door i knew we were in for a memorable stay.The room was small,(actually tiny) dark with horrible brown curtains, with a view of roof tops, old rusty radiators, chipped furniture , a tv that im sure dated to the 1970's with no remote control and not to mention very dodgy electrics...We contemplated checking out but didnt.i had to ask for a hair dryer and each time i i put it on it tripped a switch.on reporting this to a very rude male receptionist he showed me where to go to flick the switch again. yes in a fuse box down the hall.up on a chair and off you go!!!!needless to say my hair was left to dry naturally and dont mention breakfast.Its no more american buffet .its actually disgusting.Tiny pale sausages floating in hot water and baked beans no thanks.Its not located on a pretty street neither. so for the extra few bob book in some where else.this place should be closed down.

Reviews.Title: “We were surprised!”
Reviews.Author: NinafrSweden
Reviews.Content: We were positivly surprised of this hotel after reading all bad reviews. The room was clean and they cleaned it and changed towels every day. Air condition, window and balcony, bathtub even if I don´t recomend anything else than to take a shower in it. You can tell the hotell is quite old. The staff was very polite and helpfull. Breakfast was poor with only white bread and no fresh fruit or vegetables, but for three nights it was ok. They had baked beans, but I´m not a fan.... The location was perfect! And the resturants nearby served very good toasts/bikinis! Close to La Rambla and subway/metro. Not a "love nest" but a very good "base camp", money very well spent!

Reviews.Title: “Basic, clean and cheap what do you expect for your money?”
Reviews.Author: BigBumbleBee
Reviews.Content: Ten English women aged between 17 and 50ish stayed 3 nights for hen weekend. We were dreading the accomodation because such poor reviews, but the rooms we had were very clean, sheets, towels changed every day, not like the pics on review.We had hot water morning and evening. Walls were paper thin, not recommended for a romantic break. Many nationalities in hotel, but other English guest informed us that they had handbag stolen from the breakfast room, whilst she was sat at the table! Hotel seemed disinterested. However our experience of the staff was helpful and Englsih very good. We paid £80 for 3 nights B&B what do people expect for the price?

Reviews.Title: “I thought it was good”
Reviews.Author: diejam
Reviews.Content: Two early aged travelers around europe. We stayed on level one just near the stairs. The room was basic and facing the main road. Spain won a soccer match that night so there were cars beeping constantly til about 4am in the morning which made us very tired in the morning. But we got free breakfast which also had warm beans and sausage which was great. Only downfall (literally) are the stairs. We walked down the stairs when checking out and the final door to reception is level with the last stair (in other words you don't walk off the stairs and walk straight for a bit and meet a door). So yes i had a nice fall down that when i opened the door and expected a flat surface. One staff member was very friendly and ran over to help which was nice. But we didn't see any mould and had hot water for the night. English in hotel was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “The worst ever hotel I can imagine”
Reviews.Author: GyanBaba
Reviews.Content: After one night stay, we decided to leave it immediately even though we have to surrender one day's extra charge.

Reviews.Title: “Biggest dump on earth!”
Reviews.Author: brookwaters
Reviews.Content: After arriving at this [--------} and seeing our mould infested room, we decided to go to another hotel. Stay away from this place unless you are a sad loser that is planning to kill himself anyway. Funny thing was that on the roomkey (which is an actual key) it states 'if you would like to extend your stay, please let the staff know on time so they can program your key for your roomnumber.'....

Reviews.Title: “WORST hotel ever!”
Reviews.Author: Al24Birmingham
Reviews.Content: ...Just returned from a 3 night stay in this hotel. It was awful. Unfriendly staff, small and shabby rooms with no natural daylight. One of our rooms had a balacony - but this boasted nothing but poor views of dirty tower blocks outside. There were no plugs for the bath and when we asked for one we were bought one that didn't fit and then shoulders were shrugged by an unhelpful maid. The lifts do not work very well and kept skipping floors - this is difficult when you have heavy suitaces and when you have to walk through an underground car park to get there in the first place. Rooms are generally very basic and the TV in one of our rooms wasn't even tuned in so wasn't fit for use. It was also a very noisey corridor and lots of bangs and voices could be heard throughout the night. The decor is very dated and shabby and it would suprise me if this place would pass current health and safety rules. The location is handy for La Rambla but only by walking through a very grotty and run down part of the city which can be threatening and very noisey at night. The Port is around 15 minutes walk but there are several buses running right outside the hotel doors, as well as the Metro. All in all, a disappointing stay and would not recommend!

Reviews.Title: “very noisy no hot water”
Reviews.Author: bbjohn
Reviews.Content: from the 5-6.4 no hot water becuse of busted heateres. clean rooms. the rooms facing the paral lel are noisy and not for human (not isolated) the front desk is trying to bill for services not given must pay attention to details. the insulation between rooms also poor ( could hear the person next room singing in shower)

Reviews.Title: “cheap but not cheerful”
Reviews.Author: punkfairy
Reviews.Content: I have returned from a 1 week sentence at Auto Hogar My cell had no natural light from without or any charm within. I managed to upset one of the breakfast room guards by clearing a table myself to sit down his displeasure was shown for the rest of my sentence both inside the hotel and when I was in the same shop as him outside the hotel this might have been intimidating for some but I found it quite amusing. The location of Auto Hogar is excellent to see all of the attractions of Barcelona close to Metro and shops buses etc .Iif you can get used to being offered crack coke and smoke everytime you walk to las ramblas then it is perfect !!!! This hotel can be noisy at night but if you want an early night Barcelona is not the city for you anyway !!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible no hot water for my stay”
Reviews.Author: loveheart45
Reviews.Content: Do not stay at this hotel is it terrible I had no hot water for the entire stay and the staff did not move me to another room or even apologise.

Reviews.Title: “I haven't had the misfortune of spending time at her majesty's pleasure.....”
Reviews.Author: Traveller10184
Reviews.Content: but staying at the Auto Hogar gave me a good incite into what prison life may be like. Dark, dirty, poorly furnished rooms with carboard sheets, ripped curtains, stained ceilings and incredible traffic noise (even up on the 6 floor) The breakfast too was bad, although enjoyed by some of our more pikey 'inmates' who made DIY lunches from solid baguettes and manky meat!. Sticking to cereal and toast was less of a russian roulette but still quite dangerous. The position isnt the best. Yes its at the bottom of the ramblas (which is a major tourist hub if thats what you're looking for) but the feeling that you are just about to be mugged everytime you step out of your hotel is not enjoyable. Perhaps these criminals would feel at home in a room at the hotel? My advice to future travellers is to head to the north end of the ramblas and beyond. Safer, more pleasent and far far away from the hell that is 'Auto Hogar'! Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: readingmichael
Reviews.Content: A group of us stayed here for a stag weekend. The location can not be faulted, as said previously the metro is just outside and it is only a 5-10 minute walk to Ramblas. We paid £25 a night and you get what you pay for. You actually have to walk through an internal car park to get to some of the rooms (a first for me). The breakfast was verging on awful. It wasn't very clean and we were warned by the receptionist not to leave any valuables in the room (despite there being safe deposit boxes). A bunch of us picked up a nasty sickness bug as well. Whether this was down to the hotel I can't be sure. I won't be rushing back (ever).

Reviews.Title: “Affordable but far from city center”
Reviews.Author: travelingbeta
Reviews.Content: i paid $60 USD per night for a 3-night stay (with double beds) in Dec 2008. the hotels.com price included breakfast. the price was fair given the location and acceptability of cleanliness. if the price was higher, then i wouldn't stay here. the hotel is surrounded by nothing. it's a far walk to la rambla, especially in the cold. however, it's literally right next to the parell-el metro station, so you can take the subway anywhere you want since there is really nothing to do in the area. the reception speaks english. it's hit or miss with the personnel in terms of helpfulness. be careful with the city bus tour package they sell to you. there's 2 bus services in barcelona, and the hotel sold us the one that's not that popular. i suggest going to the Colon area (10 minute walk towards La Rambla) and buy it from the company named Bus Turisto. they are better because they have a variety of routes and frequent stops whereas the one the hotel sells you is the one that takes one large circle around the city. also be careful with what kind of rates the receptionist tells you. he told me the telephone usage rate in the hotel room was "very cheap." well, when i checked out, the cost was 3 euro a minute! public pay phones only cost 1 euro for 100 seconds! also, the receptionist told me that a taxi to the airport would cost 25 euro. he called one for me and i later got billed 45 euro when i got dropped off at the airport. i knew something was fishy when the taxi driver gave some money to the receptionist when the taxi driver picked me up from the hotel.........

Reviews.Title: “Location is not everything”
Reviews.Author: lonelyxpat
Reviews.Content: We arrived in this hotel straight from the airport. The lobby was small and homey with a dank smell. The receptionist was friendly but could bearly speak English. The room key was a real key that seemed to come from a 50's movie. Unfortunately, the key is also needed to lock the room from the inside. The room was small and the airconditioning warm. The bed was made of plastic and actually cracked when I joined my wife on her bed. The bathroom is circa 1960 with oldstyle shower, seperate cold and hot spouts on the sink, and slow flushing toilet. The breakfast is okay with manchego cheese, jamon and chorizo. The OJ is watered down and their bread is hard and dry. They also have lots of hardboiled eggs. The location is very convenient being walking distance to the Ramblas and the waterfront. It is a great start for a jog due to its central location.

Reviews.Title: “Good choise”
Reviews.Author: Boginia
Reviews.Content: Great location, we can walk just a few minutes to Ramblas, bus and subway close by. The price was nice and included a complet breakfast. The room was clean but a bit old and in need of some work. The staff was nice and helpfull and kept our luggage after check out untill the flight time.

Reviews.Title: “Fine!!!”
Reviews.Author: Evertonose
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very central located and is close to all sight seeing things to do in Barcelona. The reception is smart enough and check in was pretty easy. The staff were ok and happy enough to help. Next door they have a restaurant and place to sit outside and drink which is not too expensive. It is around a 10 minute stroll to La Ramblas and there are a couple of pub's to visit on the way, namely The Queen Vic. From the airport take the bus for 4EURO and take a taxi from Place de Catlunya (last stop) 9EURO if you want to keep prices down. Rooms are very standard although comfortable. We only stayed for 2 nights so it served it's purpose. My only real problem was the noise levels, which were high as well as a numatic drill outside in the morning. Breakfast was pretty poor too, although the best cup of tea I have ever tasted. In all, definately a stay for people of a budget or sightseeing - if your staying longer then it is probably not the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Does The Job”
Reviews.Author: bellevueace
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well situated. A 20 min slow stroll from the placa espana and the water fountains in one direction and a 10 min stroll to La Rambla in the other. The metro station is right by the hotel. The reception is 24 hr and the staff are friendly and helpful. My room was right at the front of the hotel on the main road which is always busy, there is traffic noise but nothing that bothered me, if you require it totally quiet ask for a room at the rear of the hotel. The room was adequate and the bed comfy, theres a daily maid service. The walls were a bit tatty and could do with painting, the bathroom was small and clean but minus plugs and a loo brush. Breakfast is 0700-1030 and is buffet style. The most tasteless beans and frankfurters ive ever had, settling for yoghurt, cereals, juice, rolls, cheese, and coffee, it was enough to fill a gap. Overall you get what you pay for as in everything. Considering it as a whole especally the location and for the price paid you cant complain. When in Barcelona again i wouldnt hesitate to stay here again, theres a number of bars next to the hotel where you can get meals at a reasonable price, if your looking for a cheap central place to stay and not expecting the hilton this really is fine.

Reviews.Title: “Run down and over-priced”
Reviews.Author: rosiep_8
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed for three days at this hotel. Though it was cheaper than other hotels that we saw we were still very disappointed with the standards considering how much we paid. We had stayed in a two and a three star hotel in France in the week before, both of which were much cheaper but higher quality. The walls in the room were filthy, as was the bath and there were problems with the shower hose. The walls are all paper thin and the hotel could generally do with a bit of a clean up. It is quite near to the harbour and la rambla, but the immediate vicinity is quite dirty, rough, and noisy. The staff to be fair were all friendly and helpful. It's ok for a short stay, but don't expect too much.

Reviews.Title: “not the ritz”
Reviews.Author: oatesyUk
Reviews.Content: my wife and i stayed here for 3 nights over easter, ok this hotel is not the ritz ,and it wont suit everyone, but if you just want somewhere to sleep in, basic accommodation thats not far from las ramblas then this place is fine. the breakfast was ok (continental) the rooms were small only a bed and a wardrobe and bathroom,but must say had no problems staying here. good location to the harbour and many other tourist sites only 25 min walk to the famous sagrada familia . there are a few seedy places near this hotel and many prostitutes ply there trade 24 hours aday but this happens in all major cities . some of the irish bars around the city give good value for money with the drinks and the food,as barcelona isnt a cheap place to visit you have to look around,theres plenty of supermarkets in the city centre and many sandwich shops too, the indoor market in las ramblas was very good . all in all a fantastic city ,and yes i would stay at this hotel again, if your planing not going out and just want to spend time in a hotel then this place wont be for you, but if you just want a base to explore the city then its fine

Reviews.Title: “Nice price....but you get exactly what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: Pippibob
Reviews.Content: I will rate this hotel with 1 star only, and only because of the price and location, near the subway and Ramblas area. They gave us room 111......and this was terrible. The hotel kitchen was located right below our room......nice to wake up early every morning when they start cleaning the dishes. Furthermore the cleaning was so noisy because of the acoustic in the hotel. All over you will not finde capets but tiles. The breakfast was disgusting and also very noisy. All the food was very low quality. We booked this hotel not because of the luxury but because we needed a cheap clean place to sleep................but it turned out, that sleeping was not so easy. Next time, we will be more than willing to pay a little extra for a better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Gfunk03
Reviews.Content: I went to Barcelona for 3 nights with a friend and we stayed in a twin room in the Auto Hogar Hotel. I can honestly say that it was a great hotel. The staff were extremely helpful and always willing to give us directions or suggest things to do. The room was basic but very clean, as was the ensuite bathroom. Breakfast had a good varitey of food. The only problem we had was the fuse blowing one morning as I dried my hair but when I phoned reception to report it they sent someone up to the room immediately to fix it. The hotel is in an excellent location, 10 minute walk to Las Ramblas and the Port and there is a metro stop right outside it. If you are looking for a central, basic, cheap, clean hotel then this is the one for you! And to the person who gave the hotel a bad review because the tv had no English speaking channels - why didn't you just stay at home if you wanted to watch tv?!

Reviews.Title: “exellent location!!!”
Reviews.Author: lexiemc
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a fantastic weekend away in barcelona.I was very worried what the hotel would be like after reading other reviews and the fact that it was alot cheaper than other hotels i looked at, and this was due to be a surprise romantic weekend away for my fiancee's 40th, and i was happily surprised!the hotel was easy to find, right next to the metro stop and close to the port and le rambles.Our room wasn't brilliant but a hell of a lot better than i was expecting, we were over looking the road with a balcony ,which admittedly was noisey at night- but the key to this is if you drink enough sangria you don't hear a thing!!! the room was big enough and very clean and the bed very comfy! We thoroughly loved barcelona and would definitely go again, we were warned about pick pockets and bag snatchers before we left but we felt perfectly safe at all times. Our flight arrived at Girona, which was so easy to get to and from barcelona ,there are regular buses just outside the airport and only cost 22 euros return, the journey was approx an hr but this flew by. it was such a relaxed city, it was wonderful to sit in the sun with a nice glass of wine and watch the world go by.

Reviews.Title: “Great place if u're in a budget!”
Reviews.Author: tahudantempe
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through hotwire. Hotwire is a letdown. The web mentioned the rack rate was 400 sth dollars per night and that we'll be saving 70 %. Instead , the rack rate when we stayed was 88 euro per night. We paid almost the same if not more through hotwire. Terrible! Anyway , back to the hotel , we stayed 3 nights in this hotel ,May 2008. It was clean and has good location ( 1 minute from the parallel station which harbors the green and the purple lines ; also next to barcelona universal hotel). La Ramblas is about 10 minutes breezy walk , the mirador colon and the seaside is about 5 minutes walk. If you plan to go to Montjouc , the furnicular departs from parallel station , so that's a plus too. The staffs are friendly and speak fluent english. Basic amenities are provided in the room , but no hairdryer. Air-con was working fine. Breakfasts were okay. There is a 24 hour supermarket, just 5 minute walk from the hotel (ask the staff for the location , they'll be most happy to direct you.). Next door there're restaurants serving pizzas , paellas , and other catalan dishes. Price is not bad , beware though if you ask for mineral water , they might pull the most expensive bottles ,water in glass bottles instead of your regular plastic bottles. It's best to ask what brand is available and how much. The tap water is drinkable , but it's not tasty (near the sea..). I wont reccomend this hotel to light-sleepers because the hotel has a lot of young guests, some nights they can be noisy. All in all , the hotel is good if u're in a budget or if u just need a place to crash in at night. Save money by getting the T-10 transportation card. It is valid for 10 trips, more than one person can use it at the same time.

Reviews.Title: “Hated This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tezjan
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel as a base near where our son is doing part of his uni course and it had good write ups.Well they must have had better rooms than us. We were took through a garage and told to go to the 2nd floor, it was a tiny room with a little window which overlooked the middle of the hotel into other bedrooms. The breakfast was no better cold beans, sausages, hard rolls, the only thing good were the cereals. So be warned. We paid £270 for 3 nights b&b. we would have been better in a Travel lodge

Reviews.Title: “cheap, cheerfull and friendly! perfect location”
Reviews.Author: lindsey123
Reviews.Content: We arrived at this hotel and were greeted by friendly & helpfull reception staff. I went there with my mum for a short city break, our twin room was huge!!!! the room was clean(ish) but the bed and bathroom were clean which is the main thing. The beds are comfortable and there was always hot water for showers. We had a room on the third floor, light sleepers may find this hotel noisy, as the hotel is located on a main road - its very bustling, you here sirens screaming past quite alot! But this is a city - what do you expect!!? The location of this hotel is amazing - about 5-10 minute walk to las ramblas. Most nights after our meal, drinks etc, we would go back to the hotel, which has a bar open until 1am, for drinks. the staff their were very friendly and happy to serve us until late. The breakfast in the hotel was very good also, plenty for everyone, and runs from 0730 - 1000 hrs. All in all I feel this hotel is cheap, cheerfull and good value for money - I will definately stay here again when I come back to Barcelona and would recommend it! - oh yeah, and for those people who have moaned and slated the hotel for 'spanish only tv channels' and 'no remote control for tv' ........what do you expect for a 2 star hotel?!

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: huntcsa
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Auto Hogar for two nights, just getting back yesterday. We were really impressed with the hotel, especially for the price. The hotel was spotlessly clean. I noticed others have commented otherwise on here, and obviously I can only comment on what I saw from the room we stayed in and the communal areas. We were offered a room with a balcony on the front, and yes it was quite noisy but, the hotel is on a main road. We were told we could have an inner room if we wanted so were given the choice. The bedding was spotlessly clean as was the bathroom/towels etc. The shower was powerful with plenty of hot water. The breakfast was excellent for a 2 star hotel. Plenty of everything, but it is kind of spread out in different parts of the very busy breakfast room, so keep your eyes peeled. The location is also great, you can walk to the Rambla in under 10 minutes and the metro is just a minute away for when u need to go further afield ie, to see the Sagrada Familia and the Park Guell which is lovely. One word of advice. I wouldn't recommend paying the 8 euros each to get into the Sagrada Familia, it is just a building site inside., and they charge yet another 2 euros to go up in the lift! Well worth going to see it from the outside though.

Reviews.Title: “Awful Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Nomeanfeet
Reviews.Content: A group of us stayed here for 2 days over a weekend and although the hotel is in an excellent location, the staff are friendly and the prices are very good there are problems. Firstly all the rooms we stayed in are in need of a new lick of paint and some general DIY to get them decent. Then they need the furniture upgrading and a major overhaul of the bathrooms is also required. The breakfast area needs cleaning and the food needs to improve. We stayed on a room facing the rear atrium and the morning view was of other guests on the toilet and there was no daylight whatsoever. Others in our group who stayed on the rooms facing the street said the rooms were much lighter but still in need of a major overhaul. Ideal for a group of drunken stag revellers but definately not for couples in need of a nice clean decent hotel.
