One plus though is that adjoining the hotel is a lovely little bar/ cafe with nice tapas.

Reviews.Title: “Hated the Auto Hogar”
Reviews.Author: lisalisalisa123
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Auto Hogar for one night in August 2007 and had an absolutely horrible experience. Dirty rooms, paper thin walls (we had to keep calling the front desk about the noise)... You have to walk through an indoor parking garage to get to your room. The worst hotel we stayed at overseas ever. The location is good, so if you stay here- plan to spend almost all of your time outside of the room. This hotel put a damper on our quick stay in Barcelona. We are usually laid back on hotels, but we absolutely hated the Auto Hogar.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: SteveMHerts
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Auto Hogar for 2 nights. I booked this hotel purely for the price £54 for the 2 night stay including breakfast, it is a great location with the Metro about 1 minute walk and Las Ramblas 10 minutes away. The rooms were clean, if not dated but want do you expect from a 2 Star Hotel ? I stayed in a room which was above the Car Park, the only down side was the other visitors lack of consideration. The noise with people shouting & slamming doors in the middle of the night was unreal. Went to watch a Barcelona match with my 11 year old son and had a fantastic time. Barcelona is a fantastic City & would go back soon. Maybe would stay in a nicer hotel but £54 for a 2 night stay. Can't be bad !!

Reviews.Title: “uumm started off well”
Reviews.Author: debt35
Reviews.Content: well arrived at hotel for a 4 night stay in january....well pleased we had a balcony... room a decent size with separate bathroom.... seemed pleased with choice, however hot water only lasted 2 days... the sink leaked all over the floor every time the tap was running... then discovered when i sneezed in bed that the leg was broken top end so collapsed several times during my stay... did ask about the hot water as it was not a pleasant shower to take in January when cold anyway!!! was told we could use another room to shower in, however did not fancy getting out of bed to go to reception with toiletry bag just to shower.....was nice to have balcony however the noise and view was not pleasant.... traffic throughout the night and people busy shouting early hours ??? why.... anyway did not expect the ritz.... breakfast was fine... plenty of it,,, not quite sure on the hot buffet though more like a warm buffett just beans and frankfurt luke warm.... otherwise pleased with breakfast staff very helpful... did ask a favour from reception to ring taxi firm to confirm collection time... was told to use phone in room .... so returned back to room.... unable to connect to speak to someone just got automated voice messages then was asked to ring later. So we left and checked out the hotel to which the man on reception chased us for one euro for the use of the phone i explained i did not manage to speak to anyone to which he printed off the phone call.... i was quite angry that one he had not helped when i asked him to ring.... two he had the nerve to ask for one euro when i had a broken sink, bed and no hot water. WOULD NOT RETURN BACK TO HOTEL IN FUTURE!!!!! Locaton was handy however a bit daunting walking back late at night the smell of drugs appeared alot when walking down the narrow streets with gangs hanging about... but had no trouble just held on to handbag quite tightly....wasnt a nice walk..... so got back to room quite early to have a drink on the noisy balcony.... did have tv in room but not one english channel available, my spanish is not that good to understand it lol.... would definately return to barcelona beautiful city with so much to see... would recomment the bus tour 2 day pass hop on and off as many times as you like... but would not recommend going away in january many restaurants empty or even shut.... so maybe return in may june time ;-)

Reviews.Title: “Auto Hogar Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KerriGateshead
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Auto Hogar Hotel 21-23 Jan. I was a bit worried reading the reviews and the fact that it was only 2* but considering how much we paid for it, it was much better than expected. The rooms were spacious and although very basic were really clean, the breakfasts were ok, plenty of yoghurts, toast, cakes, eggs etc. The staff were very helpful and I couldnt really fault it. I would actually stay here again in the future as it was in an ideally central location.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre”
Reviews.Author: teresa2582
Reviews.Content: It was kind of expensive for the quality we got. It felt like a mediocre hostel. The bed was small. The walls were super thin. The bathroom was way too small, and not the cleanest. The location is close to the metro, but really not the best first impression a person should have of Barcelona. It's by a live porno show and a billion greasy fast food places...gross. The staff was mostly very nice, however don't ask the Indian men for information...they don't know any cool spots and routinely gave us bunk info. The Internet was super expensive. 9 euros for an hour! You can get it for 1 euro down the street. Also, they were stingy with toilet paper! My boyfriend got snapped at when he asked for more rolls. First of all, why should you have to ask every day for more toilet paper? The maids hardly ever replaced them. The man at the desk literally snapped at him and questioned his toilet paper usage. Whaaaat?! Overall, I think there are better places you can find in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Does what it says on the tin”
Reviews.Author: mykitten
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews I was apprehensive about visiting this hotel. If you are looking for a budget place to stay it is excellent, does exactly what it should for such a cheap price and location. Where else will you find a hotel in the centre of such a popular tourist destination so cheap? The room we had was adequate, clean, needing a little overhaul but hey remember the price we have paid! Buffet breakfast consists of ham, cheese, chorizo, eggs, yoghurt, cereals, fruit, orange/pineapple juice (which tasted more like sunny delight) baked beans, frankfurter sausages, coffee/tea, toast lots of stuff! Reception were very helpful ( i broke my spectacles), maid service daily. You get what you pay for and although not the prettiest view or room, for a tourist who will be out and about it does the job.

Reviews.Title: “busy street!”
Reviews.Author: tomthecat
Reviews.Content: this hotel is ok. we've stayed in worse and we've stayed in better. for what we paid we got value for money. our 5th floor room overlooked the Paral-ell which got the sun and also all the noise that comes off a busy street! the room was large , beds ok, clean. the bathroom was a bit grotty with a small shower/bath cubicle thing! breakfast was included but you had to queue a while til people left their tables. the breakfast was more than adequate with a good choice. it's a short walk to the rambles and the marina and there are a good few bars/restaurants/cafes etc. nearby. all night long the street was noisy as the bars/clubs turned out. lots of shouting,sirens and cars racing. in fact when we left for the airport in the morning there were still crowds of young folk hanging around,drinking beer...still partying!! it is two stops on the metro (just outside the hotel) to the bus station where we got the bus back to girona airport. if you can't stand the noise,then don't stay here, but for us it was central,easy to get to and plenty of cafe-bars nearby.

Reviews.Title: “good location but noisy”
Reviews.Author: mick0214
Reviews.Content: Got very small room on booking in, spoke to reception and they moved us on following day to nice bright, airy room with lovely balcony over looking the Parallel street. This street is very NOISY at night with police, ambulance and every type of siren blowing all night long for a full week.Breakfast in hotel is very good and location is excellent for Las Rambles and Harbour but I again have to mention the noise from the street.

Reviews.Title: “It did what it said on the box, in a fashion”
Reviews.Author: cookieUk
Reviews.Content: To be honest I didn’t mind the Auto Hogar. I have paid more and stayed in worse. We had a room at the front of the hotel that overlooked Paral-lel which was greta during the day however the noise was pretty bad. My partner can sleep through anything but he couldn’t sleep through the noise. We both wore ear plugs which did help and the shutter on the window cut out a bit more noise. If you are a light sleeper then avoid the Auto Hogar. I didn’t mind the breakfast. There was a variety and if you got down at about 9ish there seemed to be plenty of room and the stocks high. I wouldn’t suggested getting your breakfast first then looking for a table, that seemed to be a problem with people who came down later. The location is great. Can’t recommend anywhere to eat in the area as we didn’t have much luck. The staff at the during the day were very helpful and were able to recommend things for us to do and how to best get to the airport. The blue bus is the best way to get to and from the hotel as the trains are not currently running. All in all I might stay there again if I couldn’t find anything in the same area and at reasonable cost.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, Friendly, & Cheerful”
Reviews.Author: NockMurales
Reviews.Content: I've just come back from a fantastic break in Barcelona, celebrating a friends 40th. First impressions (apart from the taxi driver laughing as he dropped us off) were good. Clean bright check in area with friendly English speaking staff. We both travelled with partners, and stayed in adjacent rooms, and whilst our friends was large and light ours was small and dark, getting NO sunlight at all. But as we only slept in the room, no problem. Our shower (power) worked a dream, and our friends was a trickle. They also had no socket for hair straighteners/hairdryer, although the latter is provided. Neither safe worked, so we had to hire one from the lobby. The hotel at night/morning was extremely noisy. Tiled floors don't help, and neither did the pipe outside our window, connected to the toilets above. However breakest was plentiful if not quite our tastes, with Tea bags and hot water giving me my morning brew. Cleaner came in every day and left the room spotless, and if nothing else it was clean. Would reccomend if on a budget

Reviews.Title: “traffic noise plus”
Reviews.Author: Keith047
Reviews.Content: Arrived late but 24hr reception was good. Had some trouble finding the carparking (under the building but off a street at the back. Reception was friendly and spoke English. We had 2 rooms and they were identical in layout on different floors but not identical in cleanliness! On one the carpet was so dirty you left black foot prints in the bathroom and on your sheets! Room size was OK but the airconditioning struggled and you could not leave the balcony door open as the traffic noise was reminicent of Bangkok! Needed double glazing and good a/c. Breakfast variety and quality was OK but the staff could not keep up and you may have to clear atable yourself and share a knife etc. Position on the edge of the old town was good, you can walk to most destinations.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap more than cheerfull, David is an asset !”
Reviews.Author: lalaluci
Reviews.Content: If you intend to be out most the time you are in Barcelona, then this will suffice. I read the reviews thoroughly, and got what I expected, the most unromantic room since Student dorms ( they are better. ) But clean, and functional ( and a double bed unusually in spain) The racket the maids make in the corridors is ambitious, but David the swiss american receptionist is amazing, possibly pre-programmed from his years of multi lingual experience !! The walk was 10 mins up nearest alley to stinking Ramblas where drinks are the biggest rip off ever. NIce city !

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Autohohohogar
Reviews.Content: My friend & I stayed at the hotel for 10 nights in September. Location fantastic, great access to Port Vell & Las Ramblas (only around 5 mins walk). Accessible to Place de Espanya as well on foot (around 10-15mins). Metro station within a minutes walk from hotel. Room was basic. Not much room for storing clothes. Bathroom - no plug in wash hand basin, showe cubilcle rather cramped, could be cleaner. Staff friendly enough. breakfast service a bit chaotic. Some mornings guests queuing to access dinig room. Had front room - this is on a very busy road, all day & night, hardly gets quiet. However would use this hotel again. - no longer. Could be better with a bit of madernisation to rooms.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: bom-bo-head
Reviews.Content: From what we could tell, this hotel is two hotels that were joined, connected by the parking garage. Older, quieter guests are placed in the front of the hotel, younger "rowdier" guests in the rear. My sister (in her mid 20's) and I (mid 30's) were placed in the party half of the hotel. We're quiet people, but we do keep late hours (as does half of Barcelona!) so we didn't mind that too much. The hotel is clean and very well located for walking around Barcelona, but it does have problems. When we checked in we realized our window didn't open. The front desk came to look at it, declared it broken, and refused to do anything (call maintenance, move us to another room, etc). He said if we wanted to see the street, we would have to open the terrace door. When I explained that as two single female travelers, we were worried that someone could climb over from the other side (believe me, it would have been easy) his response was "but this isn't their room, so they won't come in here." Unreal. However, the AC worked well, so we used that instead. The bar was missing from the toilet paper holder, so housekeeping left the rolls on the back of the toilet tank. Small details like this show the general feel of the hotel, or at least the rear "party" half of it. But like I said, it's location and price were a fair trade off.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: frankNewZealand
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews my husband and I were a little worried what we would find but were pleasantly surprised. The rooms were clean, well presented and well maintained. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful. We had a balcony room over the main street and it was ok when ranchslider closed. Of course outside is noisy and vibrant. It is inner city Barcelona after all.! We are an older and had no problems at all with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value For Money”
Reviews.Author: LiverpoolValo
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great if you just want somewhere cheap clean and with a great location. The rooms are a little dated but well maintained and cleaned for. We stayed her for a hen weekend and thoroughly enjoyed it. The location is great roughly a 10 minute walk to the main area however there is a metro station outside the hotel which is very reliable.The only thing to note it that the breakfast is a bit of a free for all so arrive early or face being disappointed with no food. Would stay again if visiting with friends or husband but not ideal for children though need something a little more modern perhaps.

Reviews.Title: “Basic Spanish Hotel Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Ogre
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews about this Hotel i was worried about going there but after i arrived i am glad i stayed there. The Auto Hogar is a typical Spanish Hotel. Rooms are quite large with a Wardrobe and TV. Some Rooms have Balconies. We stayed at the back of the hotel and yes you do have to walk through the Garage buts its so safe. Breakfast is Baguettes or Bread to Toast with Ham Cheese Salami sometimes Chicken Roll. There are Sausages and Beans as well. Cereal is also available. To drink there is Water Pineapple Juice and Orange Juice along with either Coffee or Tea. If you are staying for a while it can get a bit boring but overall you get what you pay for. Overall if you jsut want to use it as a base then this is the Hotel for you. If you want Luxury like Coffee in your room sorry you should stay somewhere else. There is a Supermarket round the corner its safe to walk there as my wife went there by herself to buy water. The only downside is the other guests who cant shut doors properly!!!

Reviews.Title: “Jewellery Went Missing”
Reviews.Author: jambo49
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at this hotel in the past and its fine for what you pay. However our experience this year was unforgettable. My wifes diamond knecklace and earrings disappeared from our room. Draw your own conclusions. Be extra vigilant if you decide to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap n Cheerful!”
Reviews.Author: Smellenwiff
Reviews.Content: Having read the reviews before I went I was anticipating the worse and hoping for slightly better. I was never expecting luxury in the first place, considering the price paid, and really just wanted somewhere to use as a base whilst exploring the sites of Barcelona by day and the bars by night! Firstly the position of the hotel is great, literally a few steps to the nearest metro, on the main bus route to sites such as the Gaudi Park etc and walking distance to Ramblas and the Port. The trade off I guess is that it's on a busy road - but that means it's good for people watching from the street cafe! Secondly the staff were friendly and helpful - both reception staff and cleaners. Thirdly, the room was clean and a good size. The view wasn't great from the balcony (just the back of another building) but I wasn't planning on sitting on it for long with so much else to do. The beds were comfy and the aircon worked well. The shower was brilliant - always plenty of hot water and powerful spray. It was cleaned daily and the towels were changed regularly. The fact that we had to cross the car park to get to it was no problem as the area is only small and well lit at night. The only problems we had, and there are always going to be a few niggles, were that where the hallways were tiled you could hear every flip flop step when your neighbours came and went from their rooms. Also the lifts were a bit temperamental - sometimes they didn't want to open the doors until you'd gone up and down a few times, but we found that if we helped the internal doors to shut properly then they were fine. All in all I'd say this was an excellent value for money hotel that is suitable if you're only looking for somewhere as a pit stop, are on a budget and aren't daft enough to expect miracles.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value but noisy”
Reviews.Author: nicbay
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 night stay at Hogar. We were a party of 3 couples - 2 of the rooms facing road at the back of hotel were fine but the other room backed onto centre of hotel (room 322) where all the plumbing was - this resulted in high level of noise from other rooms once guests started morning ablutions from about 6.30am. All floors in hotel are tiled which also results in high noise levels - room sound proofing non existent. Prior to trip was concerned re. cleanliness of hotel after reading prev. reviews but hotel was extremely clean however this resulted from the cleaners beginning cleaning outside our room at around 9am even on a Sunday - no chance of a lay in! Save for the above we found the hotel to be good value, reception staff were extremely helpful and in a brilliant location for getting out and about.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good for the price”
Reviews.Author: mariaines1505
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for about 10 days..we were 2 people, both very concerned about higiene, and must say our room was always clean. Also, the room was huge! (i guess we were lucky on that one or we booked too early) and we didn't have any problems with noise except for one night. The breakfast was pretty fine for us (we're not used to eat so much at breakfast) and we found out that the lunch area was pretty great too. The location was perfect. I'd stay there again because it's really hard to find a better room for that price in central Barcelona. The only problems was..the pillows.. were uncomfortable!

Reviews.Title: “auto horriblehotel”
Reviews.Author: brunsy
Reviews.Content: stayed here one night and it was one night too many, we were stuck out the back on the third floor, we took the lift to our room, well we tried to,the lift took us to floor 1 then 5 then 4 then back down to 1 every level but the one we wanted.We wre advised by a member of staff to forget the lift and just use the stairs, having just recovered from major back surgery my wife did'nt find this easy. Once inside our shoe box, sorry, room it took a few minutes to get used to the smell coming from the drains in the ensuite, and a wonderful choice or 11 spanish speaking tv channels to choose from this for someone who can just about grasp his native tongue, english. Breakfast, give it a miss the worst orange juice you'll ever taste and boiled sausages i know one should adopt the when in rome attitude but the sausages were beyond the pail.Finally on departure the checkin assistant asked us if we were pleased with our stay and i swear to god he kept a straight face. If you go Barcelona spend a little more than the 80 quid it cost to stay in this dump.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel OK but....the noise...the noise!!”
Reviews.Author: 1974nc
Reviews.Content: Just a quick review as hotel was ideally situated, looks ok from outside and service is fine BUT.....before you book to stay here please conduct a small experiment to check your suitability.. Go into your local town centre pub at 10pm on a saturday night and see if you can knock out some zeds whist your there! We stayed in room 408 for three nights and by night 3 I was starting to hallucinate through lack of sleep! The only times you can get some shuteye is from 11am to 5pm (main tourist times) from 6pm to 3am the constant noise is unbearable and might drive lesser men to acts of irrational violence ha ha! Seriously think carefully about staying here if sleep is high on your list of priorities and thanks very much to the young french couple in room 409 for shouting incessantly until 3am every night...

Reviews.Title: “Basic budget hotel near the Fira”
Reviews.Author: Trav-london
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights during a large conference which was at the nearby Barcelona Fira. On the positive side, the hotel was 15 minutes walk or 2 metro stops from the Fira. I can't oversate enough the importance of this when you see the hundreds of people queuing for taxis outside the Fira main gates at 7pm. My room was on 6th floor in the main part of the hotel (not the part accessed through the car park!). The room faced the main road, which could be noisy if you are not used to traffic noise. On the whole, it was not a problem, apart from one night where a large number of people were gathered on the far side of the road making a lot of noise at 5am. My guess is that it was closing time of some nearby nightclub! The hotel is also within easy walking distance to Las Ramblas. The fact that the hotel is on a main road means a good supply of taxis driving past at all times. Had drinks & tapas in the adjoining bar one evening. The tapas were nothing special but by no means offensive! The friendly staff make sure you are well looked after - in fact I still have one of their cigarette lighters! Would I stay here again? - Yes, if I was at another work event at the Fira. Would I book it for a weekend break I was organising myself - no chance, unless that is all your budget can stretch to!

Reviews.Title: “Basic but adequate”
Reviews.Author: markwood
Reviews.Content: Expected a basic budget hotel and got it. Certainly cant complain. Six of us went, 3 twin rooms. Mine was large with 3 beds, smelt a little fusty but sheets were clean. Other 2 rooms better, one had balcony. If you get one of the road facing rooms it can be little noisy in summer I suspect but as went in feb had windows shut. Breatfast basic, just stuck to toast and coffee. Only paid £23 per night so thought was good value for somewhere just to get your head down. Ideal for groups of males/females but not suitable for romantic weekend with wife! Staff friendly and spoke english. Be carful of lifts, only take 4, we broke down with6 in, didnt realise. All in all good value for money. You get what you pay for, this was very cheap but ok. Ideally located with main metro stop accross road

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and Central Base”
Reviews.Author: dcjune60
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 24-27th Nov 06 and was very pleasantly surprised by this hotel for the price. Despite reviews, our room was clean, comfortable, not noisy, had windows (!), and was not reached through a car park. Maybe we were the lucky ones! Ask for room 703 in the main hotel. Breakfast was good, staff friendly, and the room cleaned daily. Location was amazing - a 10 minute walk to La Rambla and 2 minutes from Paral Lel metro. the metro is extremely easy to use. They have a luggage room where you can leave your bags after you checkout if your flight is not til later. From Girona Airport (Ryan Air) there is a great Aerobus service called BarcelonaBus to Central Barcelona (Arc de Triomphe Metro) from where you can get the metro (with one change) to Paralell for this hotel. Return trip is @15 euros and takes 1 hour 10 mins each way. Tickets are bought at a window in the arrivals hall in the airport. We got the hotel for 35 pounds a night at the weekend on [--] and so all in all a very good value hotel for us anyway!

Reviews.Title: “Great price, very clean, but noisy!”
Reviews.Author: Paul74
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a couple of nights and really got what I was looking for - cheap, clean and central. The hotel is 50yds walk from the nearest metro station (Paral Lel) and 10 minutes walk to Las Ramblas and the waterfront. Sagrada Familia is reached on the same line (15 minutes) and the bus station 20 minutes with 1 change on the metro. Buffet breakfast is included and ok (served 7.30 - 10.30), but don't leave it until 10am to go down for it, as it is pandemonium!!! The hotel itself is clean if a little outdated, and the room I had was clean but very basic -all things that are reflected by the cheap cost. The only real downside was the noise, there is no sound proofing, so you hear every movement from every angle - only shear exhaustion from too much walking will guarantee a good nights sleep. My advice is if you don't care where you stay on a short visit, it's ok, but if you prefer more comfort and style, and you are staying longer than 2 nights, then don't bother.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: Helistin
Reviews.Content: We spent one week in Barcelona and at Auto Hogar. From Hotels.com we got very good pricing for the reservation and were actually a bit of afraid was it too good to be true... But everything was just great! The room was big and nice. There wasn't really anything extra in the room, just the very basic things which normally are in every hotel rooms. But that was just enough for us. Location was also perfect, everything in walking distance, Metro stop just next to the hotel. Well of course, as Barcelona is a big city, you could hear the noise from outside. But we got used to it quite fast. I guess we cot a bit lucky with the room we got but still; we can warmly recommend the hotel to travelers who doesn't need anything extra, just a safe place to sleep their nights. :)

Reviews.Title: “Take your sleeping pills!”
Reviews.Author: Ozturbulance
Reviews.Content: Travelled in October 06 to Barcelona. I had read other comments about this hotel so was a little apprehensive, however this was cheap and in a fantastic location. Staff all spoke english and were pleasent. Yes, you have to walk through a car park to reach the lifts to the rooms - a little annoying... My room was very very basic. This room was next to the lift shaft, so all night, I was awoken by the lifts going up and down... The whole hotel is tiled flooring, which makes all the noise travel... After a sleepless night, I requested a room change. The staff accomadated this. My new room was not much better, still close to the lift area, so still very noisy. This hotel is preety much in the centre of Barcelona, which is the only saving grace. If you choose to stay here, be prepared for a lot of noise at night and little sleep... SG Australia...

Reviews.Title: “Central and cheap”
Reviews.Author: Ange76
Reviews.Content: Having got a good deal on a room for four nights, we were concerned by the negative tone of some reviews here. We were indeed in the part of the hotel beyond the infamous car park, but we were prepared for this, and it really wasn't as bad as it may sound. Our room was generally clean and had all the necessary amenities. There was some mould on the ceiling near the window, though. Our view was out over neighbouring apartment blocks. This made it noisy on the first night (Diwali celebrations), but genuinely added some local flavour. We liked the view, though appreciate some may not. The staff were friendly and helpful, and all spoke at least some English. There was a buffet style breakfast from 0730 till 1000 with hot and cold food. Be warned that it gets busy in the breakfast room around nine; either an early start or a late one is advised. For the price paid, the location was excellent, being very close to the Metro, the port area, and the south end of La Rambla. In summary, we loved Barcelona, and, considering the price we paid, we had no major complaints about the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “good clean budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: GIZMO1674
Reviews.Content: Good location, about 8mins to rambles or sea front. For the price of the hotel it was very good value. We had to walk through a carpark and up up lots of stairs or use a lift to get to our room. This was very off putting, as it seemed like we were in a multi storey carpark. The room itself was immacaulate but basic. We were really impressed by the standard of cleanliness. We had a small balcony and a window. The breakfast which was included was good. The reception area was shabby in need of a revamp. Overall well worth what we paid, good base to explore barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Clean but noisey”
Reviews.Author: Joey1980
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the auto hogar in mid Sept. From reading the numerous bad reviews on this website about air con not working and noise (Rather stupidly after booking the hotel), we asked at check-in for a 'quiet and air conditioned room'. We were directed through the car park to a room on the 5th floor. The room was rather small and its only view was three walls, i.e we ere in the centre of the hotel. Thankfully the air conditioning, shower etc did work. The room did have a safe however we were unable to open it. Despite asking specifically for a quiet room we found our room quite noisey, not from the traffic outside but from the traffic passing by our room. Our room was right beside the elevator and the walls were like cardboard. Everything could be heard. Also at the time it appeared that building work was ongoing which added to the noise level. On a good note though, the location is brilliant and the buffet breakfast was fantastic with plenty of choice. The rooms and towels were cleaned/changed daily (Although we had left the 'do not disturb' sign, on the door each day they still came in, so i wouldnt advise leaving valuables/money lying around, not that we had any problems) All in all I guess you get what you pay for. I wouldnt recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a quiet, relaxing holiday. Its more suitable for younger people who will be out all day sightseeing and out on the town until late every night. (Although thats what we were doing most of the time and we still found the noise annoying the odd time were were there) I wouldnt return to this hotel again, id rather pay a little extra for a nicer hotel or do my research a bit better!!!

Reviews.Title: “Low Budget DUMP!”
Reviews.Author: keral
Reviews.Content: This place was a dump. Stayed there for 2 nights in June. Where do I start ... Room was tiny, air conditioner was broken, shower was broken, telephone was broken, room was old and run down. We asked if we can be moved to another room but they said they were full. The next night they moved us to the newer part of the hotel and it was no better. Would never stay or recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Initially disappointed but eventually very happy!”
Reviews.Author: rachael_salt
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as budget student travellers, wanting a comfortable and cheap place to stay whilst sightseeing and attending Summercase music festival in the city. We were very dubious after reading reviews on here and after a few initial problems concerning the air conditioning and position of our room, we came home very happy with our stay at the hotel. We arrived late at night and were directed to our room, via the famous car park! I knew this was a bad sign thanks to the previous reviews and sure enough we had a twin room (after booking specifically a double) with literally NO air conditioning. Luckily after taking advice from other reviews we'd packed a fan. Without that I would have slept in the lobbey! It was room 235 on the second floor, so beware! It was roomy and clean but dark, had no view, no breeze and the heat was inbearable. We went straight back to reception but they informed us nothing could be done until other rooms had checked out tomorrow, actually admitting the air conditioning DIDN'T work. I consider this quite bad false advertising and the booking agents should be aware of this. That night was possibly the worst nights sleep I'd ever had, the heat was indescribable! The next day after sightseeing we were shown to a room on the 7th floor, accessed via the lifts inside the lobbey. Despite being compact and very small (we lived out of our suitcases rather than putting our clothes in the damp wardrobe) it was cool and air conditioned which was all we were after. I'd definitely say temperature is more important than the space here. The room had a view looking over the best sites of the city including the Montjuic area and Sagrada Familia. The rest of our stay was extremely comfortable. Breakfast runs from 7-10:30am and gets busy after 9. It is a great Continental variety including croissants, bread rolls, toast, cereal, coffees, tea, orange+pineapple juice, fruit, selection of hams and cheese. One day we knew we wouldn't have chance to have lunch/dinner out so we made sandwiches from the breakfast. It's paid for afterall!! The staff we very helpful (apart from a couple) and spoke the best English we'd encountered in the entire trip. Our room was cleaned every day and towels changed too. One day we did not leave the room till 5 and the maids rang our room phone, insisting on cleaning it so late in the day. The rooms (also against advertisement) do not have security boxes. The first one we were unable to open and the second room didn't even have one. However, the reception staff were more than happy to let us use their safe and we accessed that every day. The location of the hotel is very good. A 2 minute walk from the metro station, 15 minutes to the Christopher Columbus monument (the bottom of the Ramblas - also where you can catch the sightseeing bus tour), 20 minutes to Port Vell and 30 minute walk to Barceloneta beach. BARCELONA TIPS... - Take the orange bus tour. It is less advertised but stops at the same ones as the "official" blue bus tour and there are always seats available on the open top. - Take care of your cash. I saw a guy steal a womans bag from next to her on a bench at Place d'Catalunya. She luckily saw it out of the corner of her eye but it really made me think. Later in the holiday I had 75 euros (£50) pickpocketed, either on the metro or the beach. They'd taken my purse out of my bag, taken the cash then put the purse bacK! Unbelievable. - Ask about the prices of drinks at bars/restaurants. They're usually not listed on the menu and can be ridiculous, like 6 euros for a small bottle of coke. - I'd recommend the pastry shop down the road from the hotel which has large cold bottles of water for 1.05 euros. - Make a trip to the Japanese restaurant a few paces to the right out of the doors of the hotel. Cheap and well worth it for the atmosphere and experience. - The magic fountains at the National Palace run thursday-sunday from 8:30-10:30. - If you're going to the Hard Rock Cafe be prepared for a wait and, if possible, say you're open to smoking and non-smoking areas to cut that wait down. If you arrive before 8 the wait for a table much less I think. - Make a trip to Port Olympic (avaible via the metro with one change from the hotel) for a meal. Great seafood and service. That's about it. The hotel was overall good for a 2*. I'm not sure whether I'd be eager to stay there again, we would possible save up to afford a better place. However, it provided exactly what we needed, a comfortable place to wash and lay our heads after a tiring day of walking in the sun. You get exactly what you pay for but I'd say it's great value for money considering the location and proximity to the port, metro, bus stops, restaurants and bars down the Ramblas.

Reviews.Title: “What No Air Con?!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The rooms we had were booked in April (so it wasn't like we left it to the last minute!) and chose this hotel because it said all rooms have air conditioning, I do not class a heater which has a cold air setting as air conditioning. We left ours on the highest setting (3) all evening as we went out for a night on the town, on our return we could not feel any difference in the temperature, we spent the night in and out of a cold bath to try and cool us down, it was unbearable! This really lets the hotel down, yes it is cheap and we did not have high expectations, we were just happy to be going to a hotel with air conditioned bedrooms. I am sure if you go there in the Autumn you would have a great stay but I would not recommend anyone go to this hotel in the Summer.

Reviews.Title: “You have to walk THROUGH the garage! A/C in part of the hotel is broken!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a new and old part - I stayed in the old part and it was a disaster! I knew I was getting a budget hotel and I was prepared, but not for this... When you arrive you walk into this nice lobby - I was impressed. After I checked in, the clerk hands us our key and then says that she will show us the way to our room. Well the way to our room was through the garage that reeks of oil and gasoline, past the garage to these miserably small and unreliable elevators and then to our room on the second floor. We had what was clearly the tiniest room on the floor according to the hotel floor plan (think cruise cabin size at best), the air conditioner did not work and the window looked out onto an air shaft (that seemed to syphon up the fumes from the garage below). I complained multiple times about the air conditioning and initially I got a shrug, then I was told someone would be trying to fix it, then I was told that the a/c on our part of the hotel was simply not working - no more explanations to be had. Finally, I had to ASK for a fan - no one ever thought to offer us one. With the fan in our already tiny room, there was no space at all - barely a path to the bathroom. The room condition was dingy, bathroom was dirty and the shower was moldy. My husband and I enjoyed the night train down to Seville more than this hotel. I would not recommend this hotel, but if you chose it, I would contact the hotel directly and request to stay in the "new" part of the hotel. I think that would be a completely different experience.

Reviews.Title: “I'm sure the main hotel is fine... but a word of warning”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Based on the reviews on this and other sites we stayed at the Auto Hogar on a hot July weekend. First impressions were fine and we made our way to our rooms which were, surprisingly, accessed through the garage at the rear of the hotel. Here there is a second and much more run down hotel. My word of warning is to avoid this part of the Auto Hogar like the plague! With two airless rooms without working air conditioning we asked to change rooms. WIth no more space available the management suggested we sleep with our doors open! Not satisfied with this option, we were eventually re-housed in the Hotel Nuevo Triunfo round the corner (+93 442 59 33). That was cool, quiet, friendly and perfect. Worth a call but haggle on the price - our rate was 25% below the advertised tarrif. Sadly this was an attempt to check out the Auto Hogar ahead of a larger trip coming later in the year. On this experience we won't be staying there and my advice is that if you are sent to your room through the garage you either get another room or check out immediately!

Reviews.Title: “Simple but nice!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned home from a week in Barcelona where we stayed at the Auto Hogar Hotel. It's a simple but nice and clean hotel with VERY friendly and helpful staff that spoke English well. The breakfast was OK, nothing special, but satisfying. Ask for a room facing the yard though! They are both cooler and more quiet, although you hear every sound that is made in the corridore! I woke up every night by the sound of someone opening their door! Otherwise - for the price - OK. I don't think I would stay there again though.

Reviews.Title: “Unimpressed!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: When myself and my girlfriend arrived, the taxi driver told us that there were alot of thieves and sexual relations problems with white women in barcelona, so it was a great start! the hotel itself wasnt the best, had to walk thru car park to get to rooms, minority of staff were unfriendly not allowing to change rooms sayin they had none left, but was obviously a lie becaause we were english. the room had air conditioning but it was about as useful as a small fire. the room was stuffy and the window didnt even lead to the outside just to another indoor part of the hotel which was extremely hot, the maids were excellent tho. (apart from eating our snacks!!) The location was poor, if you want to visit la ramblas everyday then your best satying exactly on the strip, otherwise your feet will be cut to shreds! la ramblas an barcelona itself is excellent and we had a great time however i recommend staying in a better hotel!

Reviews.Title: “surprised!”
Reviews.Author: missmarples
Reviews.Content: Having booked this hotel then reading reviews after I thought I might have to book into another hotel on arrival. Well my sister and I were delighted, our room on the 7th floor was spotless as was the bathroom, the bedding and towels were changed on a regular basis. The breakfasts were more than adequate, altho sometimes a bit of a scrum! The hotel was very central, a nice and easy walk to the port area and only seconds from the metro! which we used every day. The staff were very friendly and on our last day we did not fly until 21.45 so the luggage room was most helpfull. The only down side was the street noise and building works but hey it`s a busy busy city and the Hotel is on a busy main street, and by the time we got back to the hotel we were so exhausted with the days sightseeing that we more or less fell asleep fully clothed! We spent 7 days in Barcelona and would stay in this hotel again.

HotelInfo.Name: Auto Hogar Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Avda Parallel 64, 08001 Barcelona, Spain
